page.title: 01KIRKCALDY 1985
page.content: This part of{Kirkcaldy}is a mixture of both town and country. To the east is the town which is not only the historic centre but also the shopping and business centre. {Kirkcaldy High Street}with its fine shopping arcades is the main shopping centre for much of the county of Fife. Between the High Street and the station can be found the{War Memorials {and Gardens,}the{Museum and Art {Gallery,}the{Public Libary,}the{Adam {Smith Centre}and the{Town House. Across the Railway can be found the {Beveridge Park}with its gardens, playing fields, boating pond, children's farm and playground. The{Raith Estate}with its farms and woodlands forms a background for this part of the Burgh of Kirkcaldy.
